user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of lfs_fs_disk_version:
```c
static uint32_t lfs_fs_disk_version(lfs_t *lfs) {
    (void)lfs;
#ifdef LFS_MULTIVERSION
    if (lfs->cfg->disk_version) {
        return lfs->cfg->disk_version;
    } else
#endif
    {
        return LFS_DISK_VERSION;
    }
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function lfs_fs_disk_version:
typedef struct lfs {
    lfs_cache_t rcache;
    lfs_cache_t pcache;

    lfs_block_t root[2];
    struct lfs_mlist {
        struct lfs_mlist *next;
        uint16_t id;
        uint8_t type;
        lfs_mdir_t m;
    } *mlist;
    uint32_t seed;

    lfs_gstate_t gstate;
    lfs_gstate_t gdisk;
    lfs_gstate_t gdelta;

    struct lfs_lookahead {
        lfs_block_t start;
        lfs_block_t size;
        lfs_block_t next;
        lfs_block_t ckpoint;
        uint8_t *buffer;
    } lookahead;

    const struct lfs_config *cfg;
    lfs_size_t block_count;
    lfs_size_t name_max;
    lfs_size_t file_max;
    lfs_size_t attr_max;
    lfs_size_t inline_max;

#ifdef LFS_MIGRATE
    struct lfs1 *lfs1;
#endif
} lfs_t
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Fragments not reported do not appear to violate Rule 8.13 in the shown code. The lfs_t member "const struct lfs_config *cfg;" is already a pointer to a const-qualified type, so it satisfies the rule. Other members shown are arrays or non-pointer scalar types (e.g. lfs_block_t root[2], uint32_t seed, numeric size fields) and thus are not relevant to pointer const-qualification. The function body only reads lfs->cfg->disk_version (access via the const-qualified cfg), so the remaining code inside the function is not itself a pointer declaration needing const-qualification. The fragments listed should be investigated to determine whether those pointers are only used for read access and therefore should point to const-qualified types.
